title: Define Protocol Requirements for LowLatencyMessagingProtocol
description: Gather and document the requirements for the low-latency messaging protocol, including performance targets (sub-millisecond latency), security considerations (TLS, authentication using JWT, and authorization), compatibility with existing systems such as WebSocket, gRPC, and potentially WebAssembly. An in-depth analysis of trade-offs between latency, reliability, and security is necessary, especially considering high-frequency trading, online gaming, and other real-time applications. Additionally, explore the potential impact on data integrity, consistency, and error handling, emphasizing the importance of data verification mechanisms for ensuring correctness in critical scenarios. Include a section for detailing the expected performance under heavy load conditions to provide insights on scalability and efficiency. Furthermore, consider the long-term maintainability and extensibility of the protocol as part of the design considerations.

title: Design Protocol Architecture (Revised and Clarified)
description: This RFC provides a revised and clarified outline of the proposed architecture of the LowLatencyMessagingProtocol. The design includes message formats, transport mechanisms, error handling strategies, and a discussion on latency vs reliability trade-offs, scalability, security, and flexibility considerations tailored for high-frequency trading and online gaming environments. Open issues related to potential architectural choices and their implications are identified, along with proposed solutions. This document also includes clarifications and elaborations based on feedback received, and suggestions for further improvements and potential trade-offs are welcomed. Discussion points have been organized into clear sections for easy reference.

title: Implement Protocol Core
description: Develop the core functionality of the protocol, including message serialization/deserialization, connection management, and message routing.

title: Implement Protocol Extensions
description: Develop additional features and extensions for the protocol, such as security mechanisms, flow control, and quality of service guarantees.

title: Develop Testing Framework
description: Create a comprehensive testing framework for the protocol, including unit tests, integration tests, and performance benchmarks.

title: Conduct Security Audit
description: Perform a thorough security audit of the protocol implementation, identifying and addressing potential vulnerabilities.

title: Write Documentation
description: Prepare comprehensive documentation for the protocol, including user guides, API references, and deployment instructions.

title: Deploy and Monitor
description: Set up the necessary infrastructure for deploying and monitoring the protocol in production environments.
